Please inform all the resident mothers, and click a picture of the Lounge such that all the beds are visible. I have taken permission from mothers before clicking the picture. Click Image It is very important to maintain a stable temperature in the Lounge between 27-30°C What is the temperature recorded by the wall- mounted thermometer in the Lounge? Tick here if Lounge thermometer is not working Too warm! Please check if the A/C is working and has the right temperature setting. Too cold! Please adjust the A/C or use room heater to warm the room. Lounge temperature is good! Lounge thermometer is not working. Please notify concerned authority to get it repaired/ replaced ASAP. These babies are very fragile and can easily get infection. Observe the safety of the Lounge. No pads/ filth is lying around. Outside shoes are not being worn inside the lounge. There is no one inside the lounge who has visible signs of infection. Hand sanitizers are available and accessible to everyone. General cleanliness and hygiene are maintained inside the lounge. No! My lounge was unsafe when I checked-in. Yes! My Lounge was safe when I checked-in. Congratulations! Lounge Assessment is completed. You clicked the lounge photo after taking permission from mothers. Survey the toilet. Toilet seat is clean & toilet is flushed. Toilet tap and washbasin have running water. Toilet floor is clean and dry. Handwashing soap is available. Dustbin is present. Survey the washroom. Washroom is clean & floor is wiped. Clean bucket and mug are present. Is running water available in the tap? Soap is available. Survey the common area including dining area. Common area is clean, with no filth lying around. Area for washing utensils is clean. Dustbins are present in appropriate locations. No! Toilet was not maintained when I checked-in. Yes! Toilet was maintained when I checked-in. No! Washroom was not maintained when I checked-in. Yes! Washroom was maintained when I checked-in. No! Common area was not maintained when I checked-in. Yes! Common area was maintained when I checked-in. You noted the temperature, and it was good! No! Common area was not maintained when I checked-in. No! Toilet was not maintained when I checked-in. No! Washroom was not maintained when I checked-in. No! Common Area was not maintained when I checked-in. Counseled mother\'s/ guardian\'s on Lounge rules. //Values \u00B0 F C Direct breastfeeding Spoon/ Palladai OG Tube IV Drip EBF Formula Other Yes No BPL (Yellow Ration Card) APL (White Ration Card) Antyodaya Ration Card (Red Ration Card) No Ration Card Male Female Ambiguous Normal Normal with Episiotomy Assisted - Forceps Assisted - Vacuum Caesarian At Home On the way Mother Father Husband Other relatives Sister Brother Grand Mother Grand Father Uncle Aunty Normal/Healthy Infected Bleeding It\'s Full More than half full Filled with a quarter or less Active Healthy Lethargic The baby\'s breathing stops for more than 20 sec Chest indrawing Grunting/ Wheezing sound during breathing Check for Juandice Seizures /Fits and convulsions Inactive /Lethargy Recurrent Vomitting Unable to feed in the last 24 hours Bleeding from any part of the body Hindu Muslim Sikh Isai Buddhism General OBC SC ST Uneducated Less Than Fifth Grade Fifth Grade Pass Eight Grade Pass High School Pass Inter Pass Polytechnic - Diploma Pass Graduate Postgraduate PHD Clear Inverted nipples Normal Swollen breast with redness File issued to baby Spread clean bed sheet on bed Mother\'s /Guardian\'s belongings stored in the locker Counseled mother / guardian on lounge rules Ambulance Private Stable and not on parenteral medication, the baby’s general health is good and there is no concurrent disease such as apnoea or infection Maintaining temperature in the KMC position and mother’s bed for 3 consecutive days at room temperature Gaining 15–20 grams per day for at least 3 consecutive days Accepting feeds directly from breast (preferable) or by spoon, paladai or cup, he is feeding well, and is exclusively or predominantly breastfed The mother is confident in caring for the baby and is able to come regularly for follow-up visits. At discharge, the mother and family members must be taught to ensure that the baby is nursed in a warm room and is breastfed (Given expressed milk using paladai or cup). They should be adequately told about hygiene, danger signs, follow-up visits, immunization and prompt care seeking at a health facility. KMC should be continued as long as required and baby and mother should not be discharged in a hurry. Peripheral Cyanosis (Observe if skin is bluish only in extremities or finger, hand, and feet) Central Cyanosis (Look for bluish discoloration around the mouth, lips and tongue) No Cyanosis Dont Know Soft (Relaxed) Hard/Collapsed (Contracted) Not Applicable Hospital India Uttar Pradesh Localized Generalized < 1mm 1 – 3mm > 3mm >=1 & <5 >=5 & <10 >= 10

Baby is in danger Active No movement on stimulation The normal level of firmness or slight contraction in a resting muscle Bluish-purple discoloration of lips, tongue and inside of the mouth Bluish-purple discoloration of the skin on the fingertips, toes, palms, or feet Yellowish discoloration of the baby The temporary stoppage of breathing during sleep Abnormal voice coming from baby\'s throat The inward movement of the Chest when the child breathes in, and is a sign of respiratory distress The vestige left behind on a newborn\'s belly when the umbilical cord is cut. Condition resulting from deprivation of oxygen to a newborn baby that lasts long enough during the birth process to cause physical harm Aspiration of meconium stained amniotic fluid (MSAF) and have meconium within their lungs. A tense or bulging fontanelle occurs when fluid builds up in the brain or the brain swells, causing increased pressure inside the skull

Frequency of passing urine cannot be greater than 15 times Frequency of passing stool cannot be greater than 15 times Pulse rate cannot be less than 50 bpm and greater than 150 bpm
Baby length cannot be less than 30 cm and greater than 70 cm Head circumference cannnot be less than 25 cm and greater than 45 cm Systolic count cannot be less than 90 mm Hg and greater than 200 mm Hg Diastolic count cannot be less than 50 mm Hg and greater than 150 mm Hg Quantity of feed cannot be less than 0 ml and greater than 150 ml Delivery week cannot be less than 24 weeks and greater than 44 weeks Please Enter Unique Hospital Registration Number Mother\'s name Other (please specify)*
